meanings.definition: To commit to memory; learn by heart.
meanings.sent1: She memorized the multiplication table for her math test.
meanings.sent2: He memorized his favorite poem and recited it to his friends.
meanings.sent3: The parrot memorized a funny phrase and kept repeating it all day.
meanings.sent4: Her mind memorized the melody, playing it back effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The secret code was memorized by the spy for future use.

meanings.sent1: He memorized the directions to the park so he wouldn't get lost.
meanings.sent2: She memorized the lyrics of the song after listening to it many times.
meanings.sent3: The computer memorized the password and logged in automatically.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies always memorized her to her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunset was memorized in her mind forever.
